title: NIHCR Director pays tribute to Pakistan’s founding fathers, urges youth to follow in their footsteps
content:
ISLAMABAD, Aug 13 (APP):Director of the National Institute of Historical and Cultural Research (NIHCR) at Quaid-i-Azam University Islamabad Dr. Sajid Awan Tuesday urged the younger generation to remember the monumental efforts and sacrifices of those who fought tirelessly for the freedom of Pakistan, where millions of lives were lost in the struggle for a separate homeland.
In an Interview with PTV news channel, he emphasized the significance of understanding and honoring the country’s rich history, cultural heritage, and the unwavering resolve of its founding fathers, to inspire a sense of ownership and responsibility among the youth to take the nation forward.
The Director of NIHCR also stressed the need for the younger generation to recognize the immense efforts of those who fought for Pakistan’s independence, including the likes of Quaid-e-Azam Muhammad Ali Jinnah, Allama Muhammad Iqbal, and countless others who laid down their lives for the cause.
Dr. Awan’s message served as a reminder to the youth to stay connected to their roots and take pride in their national identity. He encouraged them to draw inspiration from the country’s rich history and cultural heritage to become active contributors to Pakistan’s progress and prosperity.
By remembering and honoring the sacrifices of those who came before us, Dr. Awan believes that the youth can develop a deeper sense of ownership and responsibility towards their country, ultimately leading to a brighter future for Pakistan.
Dr. Sajid Awan also congratulated the nation on the occasion of Independence Day and urged the youth to move forward with positivity, hope, and a sense of purpose.
He emphasized the importance of respecting and learning from their elders, who have played a significant role in shaping the country’s history.
Dr. Awan also highlighted the significance of preserving Pakistan’s cultural heritage and promoting its rich history, literature, and arts.
He urged the youth to take pride in their national identity and work towards creating a vibrant and progressive society.
By moving forward with positivity and respect for elders, Dr. Awan believes that the youth can play a vital role in building a stronger, more resilient Pakistan, where everyone has the opportunity to thrive and reach their full potential.
Dr. Sajid Awan also made a heartfelt appeal to the youth to respect and honor the national flag, which is a symbol of Pakistan’s sovereignty and identity.
He emphasized the importance of treating the flag with dignity and reverence, and urged the youth to take pride in its significance.
By respecting the national flag, Dr. Awan believes that the youth can demonstrate their love and loyalty for Pakistan, and contribute to building a more cohesive and patriotic society.
